docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 15--Anxious to avoid being considered a chronic violator of human rights, the Mexican Government has gone out of its way to try to refute recent charges by Amnesty International that as many as 200 political prisoners may be in M...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 15--Anxious to avoid being considered a chronic violator of human rights, the Mexican Government has gone out of its way to try to refute recent charges by Amnesty International that as many as 200 political prisoners may be in Mexican jails.
docs.abstract: Govt, anxious to avoid being considered chronic violator of human rights, is making concerted effort to try to refute recent charges by Amnesty Internatl that as many as 200 pol prisoners may be in jails; announces that of 172 alleged pol prisoners named by local human rights com 50 are not in jail and rest are being held on criminal charges; Lopez Portillo adm's other efforts noted; recent visit by Amnesty Internatl sec gen Martin Ennals discussed (M)

headline.main: MEXICO IS PURSUING BETTER RIGHTS IMAGE; Fights Political-Prisoner Charges and Confers With the Leader of Amnesty International Persistent Government Effort Visit Is Called 'Constructive' Efforts at Moderation

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: It is easy enough--as countless instant experts insist on demonstrating--to watch British television for a few days and reach the smug conclusion that it is as bad as, or perhaps worse than, its American counterpart. But, over the long haul, the c...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is easy enough--as countless instant experts insist on demonstrating--to watch British television for a few days and reach the smug conclusion that it is as bad as, or perhaps worse than, its American counterpart. But, over the long haul, the center of this thesis simply won't hold. The fact is that, at least occasionally, British tele vision aims a little higher.

headline.main: TV VIEW; Another Prize From Britain

docs.snippet: TRENTON Many people still cringe at the thought of modern art, believing that all modern art is abstract. But the current  exhibition of modern American art on view at the New Jersey State Museum makes it quite clear that much modern art is not ab...
docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON Many people still cringe at the thought of modern art, believing that all modern art is abstract. But the current exhibition of modern American art on view at the New Jersey State Museum makes it quite clear that much modern art is not abstract, but decidedly representational.
docs.abstract: Exhibit of modern Amer art at NJ State Museum revd by D L Shirey; illus

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES Burt Reynolds, who says he hates "Burt Reynolds movies," is writing television commercials for a different kind of movie these days. "In one of the com  mercials," he said the other day, "I'm standing in front of a theater wearing a tu...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES Burt Reynolds, who says he hates "Burt Reynolds movies," is writing television commercials for a different kind of movie these days. "In one of the com mercials," he said the other day, "I'm standing in front of a theater wearing a tuxedo and pickets are outside the theater dying. And the pickets say, 'This picture is unfair to the dead.' "
docs.abstract: End, The (Movie): Burt Reynolds, who appears in film, int; illus

headline.main: 'I'm a Star in Spite of My Movies'; Burt Reynolds

docs.snippet: Jeff Sexton drives a tractor-trailer or, as they say on citizens' band radio, an "18-wheeler." But the partner who rides in his rig, who shares his passion for cross-country trucking along with his aversion to truck-stop cooking, is not just anoth...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Sexton drives a tractor-trailer or, as they say on citizens' band radio, an "18-wheeler." But the partner who rides in his rig, who shares his passion for cross-country trucking along with his aversion to truck-stop cooking, is not just another "good buddy." She's his wife. And she's not just along for the ride.
docs.abstract: Article on increasing number of married couples who drive cross-country moving vans; illus (M)

headline.main: Two for the Road-- Married Movers; Huge Increase A New Breed
